name: The Washington

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm suprised about the negative reviews for this hotel, we found it to be ideal for our purpose with breakfast as well. I was having laser eye surgery and we needed somewhere that was nearby. The Washington is close to Clifton village and a 15-20 minute walk from the centre of Bristol. Our room was spacious with a large en-suite. Towels were clean and fluffy and the bed confortable. We had facilities to make proper coffee as well as instant and fruit in the room. Breakfast was really good with everything available and plentiful. The staff were very polite and helpful. There is an affiliated restaurant where discount is offered. My only niggle was that although it was an older building there was quite a lot of noise from the room above especially early in the morning. But I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Ideal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Washington for 2 nights. On entering the hotel my heart sank as in the reception area chatting to the receptionist were 2 young men - one shirtless with tattoos the other with a stag weekend shirt on. However the friendly receptionist assured me their rooms were nowhere near mine and to be fair to the whole party (there were quite a few!) they were very well behaved and polite and we only ever saw and heard them at breakfast. Our room was small - the double bed seemed on the small size - and as most other reviewers have said could have done with some refurbishing - the radiator would not switch off and the window was not easy to open and once opened you got the street noise - but the bathroom was fine and there was fruit as well as tea/coffee making facilities and biscuits in the room. The location was excellent - within walking distance of Clifton village and the cafes and bars on Whiteladies Road/Clifton Triangle, on the bus routes into the city centre yet fairly quiet. There are no lifts and breakfast is in the basement so not sure how less able bodied people would manage. The staff are very helpful and polite, the hotel is clean, breakfast is good (though the vegetarian sausage turned out to be a vegetable finger!) and for a city hotel the price is excellent.
reviews.title: budget hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like stepping back into the 1970, but without any of the retro. Just a run down, shabby dump with pealing plywood partitions, stained and grimy of bathroom fittings and tiny noisy rooms.
reviews.title: Shabby but not chic!

reviews.text: If it had been £30 a night this would have been forgivable. But at the prices they charge, it is severely sub-standard.
reviews.title: Dated and disappointing.

reviews.text: I'll be amazed if this place remains open for much longer. But if it does - avoid it!
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were visiting to meet some family. The hotel was basically clean and sound. The room we had was quite small with a tiny shower. The TV was ok and the parking secure but the entrance to the parking area was very tight. Breakfast was variable my omelette was very good but my wifes scrambled egg was luke warm and bland.
reviews.title: Reasonably priced basic accomodation.

reviews.text: This place is located in Clifton high above Bristol. It's uphill - so don't even think of walking from the station. Take a taxi or a bus - but expect traffic-jams. Bristol could use a decent traffic-planner and a bus-schedule that is understandable. But that has nothing to do with the hotel - I know. I was there for 4 nights in april, and was received by very friendly people at the desk. By mistake I had booked a room with no bathroom. That was changed immeditely at the reception whan I asked for it. The place is a little old, so you have to climb the stairs to the room at 2nd floor. The room was nice and ok - like a normal guesthouse-room, with a decent bathroom. Nothing special - but you get what you pay for. Breakfast was in the basement - mind your head going down there. Breakfast was fine and service down there was fine as well. There seemed to be a lot of staff for breakfast-serving, and alsom two people at reception, eventhough it's a prette small place. The hotel is associated with a bar/cafe next to the hotel. I didn't go there - but if you go out, turn left, then turn right at the corner - there's a great pub about 100 meter up. And also - don't forget an evening walk to Suspension Bridge - and bring your camera. It's very nice at sunset
reviews.title: Nice place in a nice area

reviews.text: I have to stay I found this hotel a disappointment. I thought that the decor had seen better days. In my room, the toilet seat was chipped and there was a large stain on the bathroom floor (it looked as if it was a sizeable burn). The carpet in the bedroom was also stained, and the curtain was hanging off the curtain rail.
reviews.title: A disappointing stay

reviews.text: To reach my room (with heavy luggage) I had to go up two flights of stairs, along a passageway, and then down a further set of stairs. Not very convenient.
reviews.title: Fantastic little gem.

reviews.text: The walls in the room were paper thin, and I could hear every movement from nearby rooms.
reviews.title: Character with some rough edges

reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: A real mixed bag

reviews.text: Location
reviews.title: Great stay :-)

reviews.text: Friendly, lovely receptionist
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: Powerful shower
reviews.title: What good value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Coffee, tea, hot choc, biscuits and fruit in room
reviews.title: Quaint and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decided to have a weekend break away and chose Bristol as have family in the area. This hotel was cheapest so we decided to stay there. I'm glad we did as we loved it! Yes, the rooms are a little dated, but we did see evidence of improvements going on whilst we were there. Our breakfast was included and was delicious and varied. Reception were, without question, friendly and knowledgeable about the area (though our family acted as our tourist guide for the weekend). Would we stay again? Yes we would - we paid £56 per night including breakfast and had a lovely room that was quiet and clean (though our preference would be for duvets rather than sheets) - I would highly recommend this place to others.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: Walking up to the hotel their is a red cover sheltering the entrance, the top of this was thick with green algae, warning number one!
reviews.title: Criticism

reviews.text: Reception staff were very friendly and could not do enough for you.
reviews.title: shabby

reviews.text: On walking towards my room the hallways were in very poor shape, marks all over the walls, paintwork covering the woodwork dull and in areas dirty. Carpets filthy throughout the corridors and the stairways were even more shocking too.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: On opening my room I was confronted with a stain on the carpet as large as a dinner plate. Stains on both covers for the beds too. Bathroom switch, above tiling over the sink, mirror edges thick with dust, never seen a clean. Bath facia rotting due to continuos leaks from the shower screen, this had seeped into the bathroom flooring too.
reviews.title: reasonable hotel

description: The Washington offers City accommodation in the heart of Clifton. We combine both comfort and convenience with the most competitive of prices. An absolute must for those on a budget: quality accommodation and the highest standards of service. With a Full English or Continental breakfast, bowl of fruit, biscuits and complimentary tea and coffee included in the price of every room, the Washington really is the best value Guest House in Bristol.Whatever your reason for visiting, our friendly and efficient reception team is always on hand to make sure your stay is as enjoyable as possible. No matter how long you spend with us, whether it is one day or one month, the Washington's home-from-home atmosphere will perfectly harmonize with your time in the city. Guests at the Washington have a full range of restaurants, cafes and bars on their very doorstep, with Racks Bar & Kitchen and Cafe Clifton merely a few steps away, and the busy Whiteladies road nearby. Secure onsite parking is available for a small charge.
